logic

Class Logic

  • java.lang.Object
    • logic.Logic
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ICommand

    public class Logic
extends java.lang.Object
implements ICommand
    Author:
    Baksa Domonkos The class for the game logic ICommand is an interface to get information from the GUI.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Logic

        public Logic(GUI gui,
             java.lang.String mapFilePath,
             boolean network,
             java.lang.String name1,
             java.lang.String name2,
             long startTime)
        Constructor for the game logic. It loads the layout of the map from a .txt file and sends it to all connected GUIs.
        Parameters:
        gui - Instance of the GUI on the same machine.
        mapFilePath - Path to the file containing the map
        network - Network or local game
        name1 - Name of the first player
        name2 - Name of the second player
        startTime - Time at the start of the game used for the highscore

    • Method Detail

      • onCommand

        public void onCommand(Command c)
        Function to call through the implemented interface
        Specified by:
        onCommand in interface ICommand

      • loadMap

        private void loadMap(java.lang.String filename)
              throws java.io.IOException
        Reads .txt file, iterates through the characters in it, and assigns different map blocks to each. Static blocks are stored in an array (array indices are coordinates), dynamic blocks are stored in an ArrayList.
        Parameters:
        filename - Path to the file
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • executeCommands

        private void executeCommands()
        Function to call when a new command arrives. Iterates through the ArrayList of commands (ideally storing only one element), and acts accordingly. If the command is KEY_PRESSED, tries to move the appropriate player, if it is ANIMATION_DONE, resolves events connected to movement (checks win-lose conditions, clears variables used for movement)

      • processKeyPress

        private void processKeyPress(Command c)
        Function to call if the issued command is KEY_PRESSED.
        Parameters:
        c - Movement command to execute

      • move

        private void move(GameState.FieldType player,
                  Coordinate dir)
        Function which moves the player if possible. Checks the next block in the direction of the movement. If it is free, moves there. If it is a wall or a player, does not move. If it is a crate, it calls moveCrate().
        Parameters:
        player - Player to move
        dir - Direction to move

      • moveCrate

        private void moveCrate(int playerIndex,
                       Coordinate dir)
        Function to call if the next block in the movement's direction is a crate. Checks if the block next to the crate is free, and if so, moves both crate and player.
        Parameters:
        playerIndex - Index of the player in the players ArrayList
        dir - Direction of movement

      • blockType

        private GameState.FieldType blockType(Coordinate c,
                                      Coordinate difference)
        Finds the FieldType of a block at a distance from a player.
        Parameters:
        c - Player's coordinates
        difference - X and Y distance of block from the player
        Returns:
        Dynamic block type if there is a player or crate at that position, otherwise return static block type at that position.

      • findCrateIndex

        private int findCrateIndex(Coordinate c,
                           Coordinate difference)
        Find index of a crate instance in the ArrayList containing them
        Parameters:
        c - Coordinates of the player
        difference - X and Y distance of crate from the player
        Returns:
        Index of the crate at given position in the ArrayList

      • resolveDeltas

        private void resolveDeltas()
        Clear deltas responsible for animations. Called, when the GUI finished animating the movement.

      • checkForVictory

        private boolean checkForVictory()
        Check win condition.
        Returns:
        True if all crates are over a TARGET block. False else.

      • checkForLoss

        private boolean checkForLoss()
        Check lose condition.
        Returns:
        True if a crate is in a corner (made up of walls or crates) False else.
